title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.2 (NEW 2019): STRENGTHENING SOCIAL SERVICES & ALTERNATIVE CARE

description.narrative: By the end of 2020, services with an administrative child protection mandate(social assistance, education, health) have strengthened their capacities to prevent violence against children, detect, refer and take care of child victims or at risk of violence or exploitation, in collaboration with civil society and community leaders, which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially girls, have access to appropriate and sustainable child protection services in a favourable social environment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2020, services with an administrative child protection mandate(social assistance, education, health) havestrengthened their capacities to prevent violence against children, detect, refer and take care of child victims or at risk ofviolence or exploitation, in collaboration with civil society and community leaders

description.narrative: In 2020, the Country Office continued financially supporting front-line social services to allow for the operationalization of prevention and response to violence, abuse, and exploitation of children. Investments were made to reinforce the capacities of social workers and tools were developed to prepare and respond to emergencies. A network of foster families was set up by social services with UNICEF’s support on the development of an operational guide to care for children in immediate need of assistance. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2021
